metadata.title: CVE-2022-3567 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability has been found in Linux Kernel and classified asproblematic. This vulnerability affects the functioninet6_stream_ops/inet6_dgram_ops of the component IPv6 Handler. Themanipulation leads to race condition. It is recommended to apply a patch tofix this issue. VDB-211090 is the identifier assigned to thisvulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3567` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-235-generic - 4.4.0-235.269
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-235-generic - 4.4.0-235.269
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-235-lowlatency - 4.4.0-235.269
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-200-generic - 4.15.0-200.211~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-200-generic - 4.15.0-200.211~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-200-lowlatency - 4.15.0-200.211~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1115-kvm - 4.4.0-1115.125
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1152-aws - 4.4.0-1152.167
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1146-aws - 4.15.0-1146.158~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-azure - 4.15.0-1159.174~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1141-gcp - 4.15.0-1141.157~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1111-oracle - 4.15.0-1111.122~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-235.269').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-200.211~16.04.2').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1115.125').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1152.167').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1146.158~16.04.2').

linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1141.157~16.04.2').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1111.122~16.04.2').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
